sentences.english: A ghost is following your girlfriend.
Let me talk to my girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我得跟我的女朋友談談。

sentences.english: How long have you been waiting to finally have sex with your girlfriend?
sentences.chinese: 你在最終和你女朋友發生性關係前等了有多久？

sentences.english: My father always asks me if I got a girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我父親經常詢問我是否找到了女朋友。

sentences.english: My girlfriend and I are taking the plunge.
sentences.chinese: 我女朋友和我豁出去了。

sentences.english: But Wang even did not have a girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 而王章程連女朋友都沒有。

sentences.english: W3: I want to date Chinese girls.
His girlfriend is hunky-dory, getting on nicely with almost everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他的女朋友挺不錯的，跟誰都合得來。

sentences.english: Good, because I don't think my girlfriend would be too happy with sick flowers!
sentences.chinese: 很好，我想我女朋友也不會太喜歡帶病的花兒。

sentences.english: But I bought last year for my girlfriend a very nice diamond ring.
sentences.chinese: 但我去年給我女朋友買了一個很漂亮的鑽石戒指。

sentences.english: Why not set up a time for a 20-minute chat with your girlfriends?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不設定了一個同女朋友交談20分鐘的時間？

sentences.english: Now I'm the girl he cheats on his girlfriend with.
sentences.chinese: 現在，他揹着他女朋友跟我勾勾搭搭。

sentences.english: You are my brother and she is my girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 你是我的兄弟，她是我的女朋友。

sentences.english: Of course, I could cuss like a local, but that was frowned upon by the girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我也喜歡當地壞話，但那是經皺了眉女朋友。

sentences.english: Joe's girl friend really raked him over the coals for forgetting her party.
sentences.chinese: 喬由於忘記出席女朋友的聚會，被她狠狠責備了一頓。

sentences.english: When I went to pick up my girlfriend, there was a note on the door.
sentences.chinese: 我去接我女朋友，發現門上有張條。

definition: to court/to go steady/to be dating
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
to part company/to split up/to break up
